items.content:
Lead Client-side JavaScript Developer

Posted Apr 27

Blue Orange Digital
Headquarters: San Francisco
http://blueorange.digital/
View all Blue Orange Digital jobs →

US and Canadian Applicants only, please. 

About Us
Founded by a team of freelance engineers, Blue Orange Digital wanted to bring an engineering approach to the agency model. Our projects use the latest and greatest technologies and afford/require a lot of direct code contribution from each developer. We care about the products we build and only work with clients that understand that good applications come from happy engineers. We are an entirely remote company with team members all across the US.

Job Description
We are looking for an awesome React/Redux JavaScript Developer to help us build our web application. Our application uses GraphQL and Apollo to expose Elastic Search data from our database. We’re looking for someone comfortable structuring Elastic Search queries via GraphQl and rendering pixel-perfect mocks and UI. We also have a lot of data visuals on the roadmap and experience working with D3 or other data visualization libraries is required. 

Responsibilities
  • Build reusable code and libraries for future use
  • Comfortable working with D3/react or other data viz tools to make dynamic interfaces.
  • Write well structured GraphQL queries and pattern good biding with React.
  • Optimize code for efficiency and scale.
  • Testing client-side code and data loading queries.

Skills And Qualifications
  • 4+ years working as a lead client-side developer with experience in React, Redux and Flux architecture. 
  • Basic understanding of server-side CSS pre-processing platforms, such as LESS and SASS
  • Not intimidated by amending Webpack or structuring NPM builds. 
  • We use Git and standard GitFlow.
  • Experience with React Native a plus. 

Apply for this position

items.content:
Frontend Engineer (React) - in-house or remote

Posted Apr 27

Advanon AG
Headquarters: Zürich, Switzerland
www.advanon.com
View all Advanon AG jobs →

Advanon is looking to add new talent to its IT team!
If you have the drive to push forward a B2B Fintech startup that’s leading the invoice financing marketplace in Switzerland and Germany, joining our team will put you in a prime position to do just that.
Advanon is a rapidly growing, well-funded, FinTech startup based in Zürich, with an office in Berlin. We offer an online platform that allows SMEs to sell their open invoices directly to financial investors. By that, we help SMEs to improve their cash flow, and for investors, we provide a new, short-term, and high-yielding asset class.
Our team consists of 30 (and growing) visionary people coming from diverse backgrounds (Google, ING, ETH, HEC). We are proud to say we have 19 different nationalities on the team, a growing presence of women in key roles, and a healthy work-life balance that results in high performance and achievements.

What You Would Do:
  • You will co-develop on the Advanon platform or related applications
  • You will present and evaluate new technologies and architectures, and contribute within all development life-cycles
  • You will work together in small, highly motivated, interdisciplinary teams, which will change the way current financing is being done
  • You will face unforeseen situations where you are always welcome to bring in your inputs on finding solutions - so you will be highly challenged!

What We Expect:
  • You have a degree in Computer Science, or equivalent training
  • You have 2+ years experience in development, using Javascript (React / Redux, 1 year minimum)
  • You are experienced in test-driven development
  • You have knowledge of relational databases, PostgreSQL and ORM technologies
  • You have knowledge of micro-service and REST API architectures
  • You have experience with AWS and other Cloud providers
  • You have an in interest and understanding of at least one of the following: Machine Learning, IT Security, Database design, Software Architecture, Scrum management
  • You are fluent in English (German an advantage)
  • You have innovative ideas and a true passion for startups, an interest in fintech is a plus
  • You have an independent work style and the ability to work under pressure
  • If applying for a remote position you are located near our timezone UTC+2 (+/- 3h)
  • If applying for an in-house position you have valid working permission for Switzerland or EU citizenship

What We Offer:
  • Competitive salary + share option possibilities
  • Spend time with an innovative and passionate group of professionals building an exceptional product
  • ADVAPERKS, an awesome benefits package: Unlimited holiday, 2 weeks per year flight/hotel for holiday is paid, annual transport passes, brekkie/TGIF events, budget for free-time courses, 3-6 months parental leave, remote work time, and even a laundry service option!

Do you fit the profile we are seeking? If your profile fits our expectations we will get back to you within a week.
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Apply for this position

Apply via this link: https://advanon.join.com/jobs/421

items.content:
Front End Developer - Marketing site - Next.js, Prismic CMS

Posted Apr 26

ScreenCloud
Headquarters: London
https://screen.cloud/
View all ScreenCloud jobs →

Front End Developer - Marketing site - Next.js, Prismic CMS

ScreenCloud makes it super simple for a business to turn any screen into a digital sign using consumer hardware. We have over 3,000 customers all over the world in retail & hospitality, education and corporate communications. They range from small businesses to huge enterprises. We have recently ramped up our marketing and need an experienced front end developer to support the team.

We are looking for a bright, enthusiastic and passionate person to manage the development of our marketing efforts. To begin with you will take on our new website and make it your own.

We are developing with next.js (https://github.com/zeit/next.js/) with server rendering only of course. Right now we push to zeit now for easy deployment and then hook our dns to that.  The codebase utilises SCSS modules as well (https://github.com/zeit/next-plugins/blob/master/packages/next-sass/readme.md)

The site hooks up to Prismic CMS https://prismic.io/ up to this, the CMS structure for that is already in place. Prismic has a React lib https://prismic.io/docs/reactjs/getting-started/getting-started-from-scratch and https://github.com/prismicio/prismic-reactjs

You will have strong JavaScript and Front End engineering skills, be a strong team player and communicator with plenty of interest in technology and being part of a growing SaaS businesses.

You will be working with the design, content and marketing team to produce a world class top of funnel marketing platform.

You may question whether this is a full time role but we have plenty of initiatives we want to launch with resellers, partners, online education, developer sites etc. There will be plenty of work!

REQUIREMENTS

We are looking for someone with experience of working in an online agency or business (preferably SaaS). You will need to be a self-starter and creative in your thinking around potential opportunities we could seize to help us grow our business.

Specifically we would be looking for:

  • At least 3 years experience in a front end developer role

  • Strong attention to detail

  • Design orientated

  • Up to speed on technical SEO requirements

  • Thoughtful about page speed optimisation

  • Proven creative problem-solving

  • Motivated and able to work autonomously

  • Interest in technology and SaaS-businesses

BENEFITS

Competitive salary based on experience and qualifications. We also have an employee share scheme that you would be eligible for after 3 months.

In terms of holiday we have an unlimited policy. This is because we want to treat people like adults and not track every bit of time off they have.

We are open to remote workers or those that want to base with our London office. Our preference is for those within a 3 hour time zone radius of the UK for closer collaboration. We will organise two company offsite trips per year so you will feel a proper part of the team. We are an international company with teams in UK, USA, Ukraine and Thailand. We look forward to hearing from you!

KEY TECH SKILLS

  • Javascript

  • Frontend Development

  • SCSS / SASS

  • React.js

  • Next.Js

  • Prismic CMS

Apply for this position

Through our Bamboo HR system send us a Cover letter (short intro), CV and Github link to code samples in order to be considered for interview:https://screencloud.bamboohr.co.uk/jobs/view.php?id=1

items.title: Full stack C# developer (5+ years) with fun startup
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=26, c=4, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=2, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=44}
items.content:
We are Appraisd, and we’ve built a fantastic tool used by 100’s of organisations to improve the way employees are managed, developed and engaged.

Although we’re a very small team, you could call us an established start-up. We’re funded entirely by our customers. There’s no hype, we simply sell a great product.

What are we looking for?

We’re looking for a mid-to-senior-level full stack developer to work directly with me, the founder, and our CTO and UI designer to develop new features for Appraisd. Most of the work will be focused on the back-end but front-end skills are desirable too.

There will be plenty of discussion and debate, so if you’re looking to grow and learn, this is the place to be. I personally see this as a vital role and am excited about the prospect of someone filling the seat.

Skills needed – minimum 5 years professional experience

- C# .NET MVC and WebApi, EF, SimpleInjector, Visual Studio, SQL, Azure etc.
- Native HTML, LESS or SCSS
- Native JS, VueJS, Angular/AngularJS, Typescript a bonus
- Bootstrap 2.3 and 3 experience
- Git
- Excellent communications skills, ability to think beyond the work beyond the backlog and be a part of the overall strategy
- Appraisd is responsive so you’ll need to write both for desktop and mobile – although most of our users view Appraisd on their desktops.

We can we offer you?

We’ll pay you a great wage and you’ll work in our very friendly and attractive Kentish Town warehouse office with our small but happy and enthusiastic team. Remote work for 1-2 days per week will be considered - or if you want to go off for a week to code from a cafe in Berlin that's fine too, and why not!

We have various perks here and there but to be honest I think what’s most important is that you can see the impact of your work, develop your skills and be inspired by others around you – and all this I can guarantee.

To get the ball rolling, please get in touch with your CV plus examples of work you’ve done already. Please also let us know…

– what frameworks and libraries you’ve used before or are interested in
– any Codepen/Github stuff you’ve done or SO profile
– an opinion of our website our app
– what is your expected salary and availability.

To start as soon as possible at our office in Kentish Town.

Absolutely no agencies please, we’ve had a lot of success posting jobs like this one and don’t need any help.

Thanks,

Roly
Founder
Appraisd
www.appraisd.com

items.title: GMB: Front-End Developer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=10, embedded=0, frontend=38}
items.content:
Front-End Developer

Posted Apr 26

GMB
Headquarters: Remote! We are an online company.
https://gmb.io/
View all GMB jobs →

Hi, we’re GMB, and we teach people how to use their bodies better. 

The word “fitness” has been perverted to mean doing things you hate to impress people you don’t like with a body that’s too tired and sore to do anything fun. We’re here to change that, and we need your help.


We started out in 2010 with an email subscription form, a YouTube account, and a lot of scrambling to figure things out. Even with over 40,000 clients in 80 countries, pretty much everything about how we’ve built our company and marketed our products has been bootstrapped by a small group of deeply invested people wearing a lot of hats and learning as we went along. Even with a team of over twenty people, that’s our DNA – learning and making it work.

This year, we’re making big changes to our product and we are looking for a Front-End WP Developer to join GMB, part-time to start. You’ll be part of a team that is helping to imagine and build new products — as well as improve existing ones.

What will be your responsibilities?

  • Working directly with our graphic designer to bring new design to code
  • Update and improve existing front-end code
  • Potential to work on the next version of our app and be involved in styleguide and UI library creation

To do this job, you will need:

  • Experience bringing WordPress themes to code (HTML/CSS/JS)
  • Some sense or experience in UX design
  • Familiarity with modern front-end tools (Gulp, Sass, etc.)
  • Experience using git and GitHub workflows
  • Familiarity with CSS methodology (SMACSS, BEM, etc.)
  • Bonus points for some back-end and API familiarity especially with regard to WordPress

Other Requirements & Competencies

  • You’ve been following GMB for a while and understand what sets us apart from other fitness companies.
  • Are clear on the value you’ll bring to the team.
  • Know how to follow instructions and how to be creative – and how to choose between them.
  • Speak and read/write perfect English.
  • Have a sense of humor.
  • Always work to develop a growth mindset.
  • Good at self-managing.
  • Have a strong DIY ethic – know what you don’t know and what you can do about it.
  • Can make things happen. You are a doer/maker as well as a planner.
  • Can manage written communication with a lot of different people.
Compensation is competitive and commensurate with experience, but you can get a pretty good sense of our benefits and such here.

What’s it like working at GMB?

GMB is a kick-ass company.

GMB is about creating autonomy. We’re working to make the world a better place by teaching people to take control of what their bodies can do so they can contribute to their families and communities. We create options for exploration and self-expression.


And we work the way we practice. Like our idea of fitness and the way we deliver our programs, very little about the way we work is like what you’d find in a traditional company. Here’s how we exemplify autonomy at work:

 Work and Live Anywhere

 Set Your Own Schedule.

 Create Your Own Role.

We also take care of our people. Building a great team with full autonomy requires more than just freedom; we thrive in an environment that supports development and growth… and we bet you will too. Some of the things we value and encourage are: continuous learning, travel & facetime, as well as time off. Learn more about all our benefits here.

If you like what you’ve read so far, familiarize yourself with who we are and what we’re about before going any further. You should also listen to this interview with Andy about how we grew GMB and what’s important to us.

Want to learn more about the smart, fun people you’ll be working with? Check out our team.

  

How To Apply

If you’re thinking, “I know how to use an APP; I’d be great at this,” you’re probably wrong. Please read everything above carefully and make sure you understand that there are some fairly complex and technical requirements.

If that all sounds like stuff you can handle, we’d love to hear from you. Please fill in the APPLICATION FORM HERE and make a case for why you’ll be a great fit for the team.


Apply for this position

If you’re thinking, “I know how to use an APP; I’d be great at this,” you’re probably wrong. Please read everything above carefully and make sure you understand that there are some fairly complex and technical requirements.If that all sounds like stuff you can handle, we’d love to hear from you. Please fill in the application form on our site and make a case for why you’ll be a great fit for the team: https://gmb.io/hiring/front-end-developer/

Full-stack developer (Node/React/Neo4J/Elasticsearch) at 1000 Cookbooks

London, Poland, Zurich, Remote · Full Time
Skills
Web Development, React.js, ElasticSearch , GraphQL/Apollo
Compensation
£45K–£60K
No Equity
Visa Sponsorship
Not available

Job Description

Are you an experienced software developer with an interest in food and cooking?

The ckbk service is currently in early testing and we are recruiting to strengthen and expand our development team as we prepare for launch.

Skills/experience that we are looking for include:
- JS based web development using React/Node/Angular
- App development using React Native
- GraphQL / Neo4J
- Elasticsearch
- Recommendation, clustering and classification using graph algorithms and/or ML

The relevant candidate will have:
- Solid technical fundamentals
- Commitment to outstanding user-experience
- Good communication skills
- Ability to collaborate effectively as part of a distributed team
- An appreciation and enthusiasm for the world of food

Perks:
- Fast-paced small company environment
- Significant input into the direction of the ckbk service
- Work on a topic (food & cooking) which is relevant to everyone
- Help to deliver a service which customers are desperate to get their hands on, asking "why has no one thought of this before?"
- Food-related company events!

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=0, dotnet=0, c=16, mobile=3, go=0, nodejs=14, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=3, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=24, frontend=41}
items.content:
Full Stack Embedded Software Engineer at Misceo Grand Technology

San Jose, Remote · Full Time
Compensation
$85K–$100K
0.2%–0.5%
Visa Sponsorship
Not available

Job Description

Responsibilities

SUMMARY OF RESPONSIBILITIES

Misceo Grand Technology is seeking applicants interested in building leading edge medical devices and systems. Company is working in the space of connected healthcare providing next generation monitoring technology.

KEY FUNCTIONS

• We are looking for a software engineer with a blended skillset: digital/analog hardware familiarity, firmware, code on Linux and other platforms, e.g., Android, cloud. Familiarity with UI/UX technologies and web technologies.
• We are always looking for quality minds. We value curiosity and the internal drive to learn.
• Familiarity with signal processing, and sensor fusion among other requirements .

Qualifications :

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
• Bachelor of Science or Master of Science in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Mathematics or related discipline.

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
• Proficiency in the C language. Working knowledge with one or more of: Python, C++, JavaScript,Node.js, Java.
• Deep experience with the Linux platform as both user and developer: tools, application development workflow, system programming.
• Familiarity with laboratory tools such as oscilloscopes, power supplies and multimeters.
• Effective verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
• Understanding of real-time, embedded, low power systems.
• Working knowledge of typical hardware interfaces: I2C, SPI, GPIO, UART, etc.
• Working knowledge of communication protocols like : BLE, MQTT , WiFi
• Working knowledge of typical networking stack and architectural principles: Ethernet, TCP/IP suite, HTTP, web services, e.g., REST.
• General, background familiarity with web technologies: databases, SQL, front-end frameworks, e.g., Angular/React/Ember/Backbone/Bootstrap

items.content:
ckbk is a new digital subscription service for food lovers, created by 1000 Cookbooks Ltd, an early stage startup based in London and New York.

The press have dubbed ckbk "Spotify for Recipes", and the response to April 2018 announcement of the service has been phenomenal with thousands of would-be subscribers joining our wait list in just a few hours:
* "Unbelievably perfect idea!!"
* "What a great idea"
* "Can’t wait for the launch!"
* "Sounds like cookbook heaven!"
* "How had no one ever thought of this?”

We have licensed hundreds of the world's best and most influential cookbooks from dozens of licensing partners to create the ultimate one-stop destination for food lovers. The ckbk service makes the full content of hundreds of cookbooks, including over 100,000+ recipes, instantly searchable and accessible from any device. Users can create their own "playlists" of favourite recipes, and discover new recipes, books, authors via our smart personalized recommendations.

To find out more about the service, visit www.ckbk.com
Are you an experienced software developer with an interest in food and cooking?

The ckbk service is currently in early testing and we are recruiting to strengthen and expand our development team as we prepare for launch.

*Skills/experience that we are looking for include:*
* JS based web development using React/Node/Angular
* App development using React Native
* GraphQL / Neo4J
* Elasticsearch
* Recommendation, clustering and classification using graph algorithms and/or ML

*The relevant candidate will have:*
* Solid technical fundamentals
* Commitment to outstanding user-experience
* Good communication skills
* Ability to collaborate effectively as part of a distributed team
* An appreciation and enthusiasm for the world of food

*Perks:*
* Fast-paced small company environment
* Significant input into the direction of the ckbk service
* Work on a topic (food & cooking) which is relevant to everyone
* Help to deliver a service which customers are desperate to get their hands on, asking "why has no one thought of this before?"
* Food-related company events!

The ckbk service is currently in early testing and we are recruiting to strengthen and expand our development team as we prepare for launch.

Skills/experience that we are looking for include:
* JS based web development using React/Node/Angular (required)
* Elasticsearch (desirable)
* GraphQL / Neo4J (relevant)
* App development using React Native (relevant)
* Recommendation, clustering and classification using graph algorithms and/or ML (relevant)

The relevant candidate will have:
* Solid technical fundamentals
* Commitment to outstanding user-experience
* Good communication skills
* Ability to collaborate effectively as part of a distributed team
* An appreciation and enthusiasm for the world of food

*Perks:*
* Fast-paced small company environment
* Significant input into the direction of the ckbk service
* Work on a topic (food & cooking) which is relevant to everyone
* Help to deliver a service which customers are desperate to get their hands on, asking "why has no one thought of this before?"
* Food-related company events!

items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: Frontend Developer
Industry: Cloud-Based Solutions, Insurance, Web Development
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Job description

We are hiring for a mid-level frontend developer who will be able to bridge the gap between our design and full stack development teams. The ideal person will have solid HTML, CSS and JS skills and be able to craft delightful user experiences in a scalable way.

This is a position on our design team, which means you will have a big say in how we architect the design system that powers all of our app's UI and UX. With that in mind, we are looking for someone who can do more than just re-create a mockup – We're looking for someone who can think critically and help us create better experiences for our users, while working closely with our full stack developers who are creating the core business logic.

The kind of work we do
BriteCore is essentially a CMS for insurance companies. They use it to manage all aspects of their business, including tracking policies, contacts and handling claims.

This means our users typically see our app more as a business tool like Microsoft Word or Google Sheets than a website (even though it is completely a web app). They also are using BriteCore for several hours every day, and are concerned with doing things quickly and efficiently. This, along with the complicated nature of insurance, means we deal with some complex workflows, and try to set ourselves apart from our competitors with a smooth UX that helps them navigate these tough processes.

What you might be doing
We're looking for someone who can really help us take our frontend system to the next level, and this includes things like:

  • Creating, in collaboration with designers, a modular, scalable design system that can be used by other developers to quickly and consistently build out new features.
  • Implementing a robust hotkey system, to allow our users to quickly accomplish tasks in the app.
  • Help us implement better user analytics, and eventually allow us to A/B test new features/designs.


What it is like to work here
BriteCore is a remote-first company — even employees who live in our home city of Springfield, MO usually work from home! And most of the people you will work with are scattered across the US and the globe. This means that remote team members are just as much part of the company as local employees. We also allow a lot of flexibility in terms of time off. In return, we expect all of our employees to be productive and accountable, which means you'll work alongside a great, dedicated team.

Responsibilities

  • Work alongside designers to implement features, with a focus on great UX. 
  • Have a keen sense for what makes an attractive UI
  • Structure and develop code in a component-driven, scalable way
  • Have a thorough understanding of HTML/CSS/JS best practices.
  • Communicate clearly
  • Welcome feedback and collaboration
  • Be friendly, confident, and patient with others
  • Self-direct
  • Stay up on industry best practices and trends


Technologies We Use

  • Vue.js (Experience with Vue, or another frontend JS framework is required)
  • SCSS
  • PostCSS
  • HTML5
  • Webpack
  • Github, various CLI tools


Benefits and Compensation

  • $50k-$70k based on experience and proven performance
  • Benefit from working alongside and observing a team of world-class engineers and designers
  • Comprehensive health insurance coverage including medical, dental, and vision for US-based applicants
  • Flexible schedule
  • Relaxed work environment
  • Remote work
  • Flexible learning time — explore your ideas and new technologies on the clock

About BriteCore

At BriteCore, we build gorgeous, scalable, and usable cloud-based insurance software. This is a company founded by, and run by software engineers. We have created a team of top performers developing modern systems for the insurance industry. Our team enjoys working together, and takes tremendous pride and ownership in our platform.

We promote a high quality of life for our employees by allowing them to choose their own schedule and location. Bring creativity, focus, and productivity to your job, and enjoy 40 hour work weeks, flexible paid time off, and remote work.

Benefits

Flexible Hours
3+ weeks Paid Time Off
Competitive Compensation
Comprehensive Health Insurance
Most employees work remotely
Relaxed Work Environment
Explore ideas, new technologies on the clock
Annually attend a conference of your choice
Work alongside talented developers
Can buy shares of company stock

items.title: Senior Front-undefined Engineer at Packet Fabric (Los Angeles, CA)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=18, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=5, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=5, embedded=0, frontend=51}
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior
Role: Frontend Developer
Industry: Big Data, Data & Analytics, Internet of Things
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Job Description

Quickly maturing startup seeking like minded Sr. Front-End Engineer!  PacketFabric is creating the simplest way to connect networks to exchange traffic, regardless of location.  The technical team is a small, talented, and close knit group. We have a bond formed from the love of running head long at difficult problems and finding highly effective solutions.

As a well rounded software engineer, you should definitely be the type that appreciates diversity in your day, and challenges outside of your comfort level! You will own the entire front end application, so you must come armed with a solid understanding good programming principles, have a nearly magical intuition for good UI, and excellent understanding of front end frameworks.

A typical day in the life of a PacketFabric software engineer might include these types of activities:

  • Architecting completely new features - such as a UI for white listing and black listing - with code reuse, client experience, and speed in mind.
  • Scrutinizing page load times and refactoring code to optimize user experience for viewing large data sets with thousands, and tens of thousands of items
  • Working closely with the UI/UX and product leads to add an intuitive features, such as easy to configure network QoS levels.
  • Working with back-end engineers and discussing quirks in network protocols and network interconnection which translate rapid API and UI changes.
  • Interacting with customers and/or sales on a bug in the software, quickly resolving it, and coordinating across the team to push a fix.
  • Researching additional ideas you may have, like how to make picking and visualizing user/free VLANs a better experience for the customer.

Skills & Requirements

The right candidates will have an extreme abundance of hard core programming skills, have solid instincts for usability and creating beautiful functional web applications.  You are probably a full stack developer who naturally gravitates towards front end work. You know how to sacrifice algorithm elegance, for getting it done on deadline. You don't even need to be reminded of safe/secure programming practices, because things as simple as session security are inherent to your nature.  More specifics include:

  • Extensive previous experience with AngularJS, Javascript, and JQuery all in a highly maintainable format.
  • A solid foundation with MVC frameworks, and OO programming paradigms.
  • Be completely at home on the *nix command line, and have loads of previous experience with PHP or Python.
  • Experience writing code that interacts asynchronously with detailed APIs on complex logic flows.
  • Experience with d3.js, and in particular, time series data.
  • Experience large scale data visualizations of any type.
  • Previous exposure to networking protocols and concepts such as IPv4/6, VLANs, VPNs, BGP, etc.
  • Experience with Angular and RxJS is a plus.
  • A huge plus for actually doing any router/switch configuration or automation.
  • Never being afraid to venture boldly where none have gone before, and develop code where there are no previous libraries to draw from.

About Packet Fabric

What PacketFabric doesn't offer:
- a dress code - so sorry, no casual Fridays
- pre-meetings where we plan meetings
- hours wasted in traffic commuting to the office
- dull moments
- rigid and defined job structure

What PacketFabric does offer:

- an opportunity to create in the space of new technologies like SDN and large data sets
- flexibility to play the different hats in a start up
- the change to disrupt entrenched Internet infrastructure
- interaction and involvement with the community groups such as Open-IX, Nanog, and RIPE
- new and interesting problems around automation of fundamental Internet infrastructure
- a team that likes to learn from each other
- a continuous develop environment where we are always turning out new features
- the ability to work with many different technologies
- the ability to work with lots of open source technology
- a non-corporate and relaxed atmosphere, with small company culture
- VERY good health, dental, and 401K

Benefits

Excellent Health Insurance
401K
Remote Work
Awesome team mates
Solve difficult problems
Stock Options
Your work makes a BIG impact
Small company culture

items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: B2B Sales, Events, SaaS
Company size: 11-50 people

Job description

We work in Ruby, JavaScript, SQL, CSS and HTML. We use frameworks (RoR, Ember, React) and language extensions (Sass, Haml, CoffeeScript), but known they come and go. You will work as a trusted peer on a small team to implement new features. We all work on each layer in the stack, and we all fix bugs between feature releases. We all help each other. We use agile methods (yes really use them, not just use the tools and call it agile). We deliver features in two to four week sprints.

We are looking for a talented software engineer committed to his or her craft to become a key member of our small growing team. You can work locally, in our beautiful small city (Traverse City MI), or remotely. Remote employees must have a four or more hour overlap in work hours with the eastern time zone (EST/UTC-5).

Skills & Requirements

Excellent coding skills

Experience delivering web applications

Strong problem solving and critical thinking skills

Excellent communication skills

About GeoTix

We (Geotix) are a funded, nimble community driven event-ticketing company.

We believe software is a craft that requires continual learning and improvement. We believe that software needs to be well tested as a means to evolving it through refactoring. We believe that good code comes from clear understanding of the domain and applying proper modeling and disciplined coding practices. While we practice what we preach, we also know that entropy is the opposite force, and that our commitment is what keeps everything in balance. We believe in clear open communication. We believe in respect of everyone. We believe that work and life need to be in balance and that sacrificing sleep does not 'make up' schedule time.

Benefits

Outstanding healthcare
Solid 401 K Plan
We fund attendance and participation in tech conferences
Support and/or contributions to open source projects that we use
Relocation assistance available

items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior
Role: Frontend Developer, Backend Developer
Industry: Software Consulting, Software Development / Engineering, Web Technology
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Job description

What your day looks like

With your first cup of coffee in hand, you skip the traffic-packed drive and stroll down the hall to your home office. You turn on your monitor and join the hangout for your daily Standup. Call done, you hit play on your favourite playlist, tap the volume key a few times and get in the zone. There are some GitHub PRs you need to review, so you head there first. The rest of the morning goes by working on that feature for the weekly client demo tomorrow. Lunchtime arrives so you head to your Yoga class. Feeling stretched and relaxed, you make yourself something to eat, grab (another) cup of coffee and get back to work. Some remote problem solving with the team and then it’s back to code. Hunger calls (where did the day go) and you know it’s time to shut the laptop. After catching up on everyone's day you go pack for your trip to NodeConf the next day.

What you’ll be doing

At nearForm, we work with international clients who are industry leaders in their respective fields. Our role is to help them build solutions and platforms; help them to launch new product ventures and fundamentally change how they operate.

Join a highly skilled multidisciplinary team; typically consisting of designers, front-end and back-end experts, DevOps engineers, and also members of the client team. This mix follows a modern agile development methodology where we run 2-week sprints with a defined backlog, daily standups, weekly demos, sprint planning and sprint retros; all with as little ceremony as necessary.

What we ask of you

  • 7+ years experience developing at an enterprise level
  • An ability to use a wide variety of open source technologies and tools
  • An ability to perform well in a fast-paced environment
  • Excellent analytical and multitasking skills
  • Located in Ireland or the UK
  • Availability for short-term travel on a semi-regular basis
  • Fluent English

For Front-end add:

  • Extensive hands-on experience with:
    • JavaScript Frameworks must include React
    • HTML and CSS pre-processing platforms, such as LESS and SASS
    • Best practice and design patterns, such as CSS paradigms (OOCSS, SMACSS, and BEM)
    • Ajax, JSON and RESTful Web services
    • Best practice front-end security, familiarity with OWASP top 10
    • Modern knowledge of front-end performance
    • Build tools such as Gulp, Grunt, Browserify and Webpack
    • Versioning tools, particularly GIT
    • Browser testing and debugging
    • Cross-browser compatibility issues and ways to work around them
    • Layout aesthetics, responsive design and mobile web development

For Back-end add:

  • Extensive hands-on experience with:
    • JavaScript must include Node.js
    • SQL and Document-Oriented Databases
    • Ajax, JSON and RESTful Web services
    • Versioning tools, particularly GIT
    • Testing and debugging
    • Cloud architecture and administration
    • Systems integration

About nearForm

nearForm is the next evolution of a software company. Our team of exceptional people build better software faster, for our clients and our communities.

Benefits

Best People: we hire the best people from all over the world
Open Source: we aim to make significant contributions to Open Source
Work/Life Balance: we have a genuine commitment to work-life balance
Flexible: we support a schedule that fits your style
Family-Friendly: we offer parental and maternity leave, flexible hours
Location: join us at HQ and go for a surf at lunch time
Work Remotely: you don't have to be at HQ, work wherever suits you
The Wellness Hub: we offer resources and support for your wellbeing

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior, Lead, Manager
Role: QA/Test Developer
Industry: Computer Software, Enterprise Software, Software Consulting
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Job description

ESW Capital takes an unorthodox approach to hiring in an attempt to improve the candidate experience by expediting the hiring process through an innovate online hiring tournament. Candidates will receive an offer as soon as the day of the event should they be successful.

We're running an Online Hiring Tournament on April 28th to hire Chief Software Architects (USD $100K/yr) with expertise in Cloud OR Java OR C++ OR Angular OR PHP OR Test Automation.If you are not familiar with any of those technologies, you should not attend the event as we currently have openings only in those roles.

This event will include testing. Upon grading the deliverables from the event, we will set up qualified candidates with an interview with the hiring manager, who can hire 20 Chief Architects. This is a 100% remote, full-time role.

This position is with ESW Capital or one of its affiliated companies.

As a Chief Architect you will be responsible for developing solutions to complex architectural problems, designing and delivering real enterprise-class software products to customers and being a hands-on peer leader of top development resources. As the owner for the architecture and technical delivery of a multi-million dollar revenue per year enterprise software product, you will effectively work as the CTO of the engagement with a startup mindset, wearing multiple hats from lead architect and developer on the most complex elements of the product to technical team leader to solution evangelist ensuring that the customers are blown away by the technical differentiation and quality of the product.

You will be tested in one of the following technologies based on your expertise:

  • Java
  • Cloud
  • C++
  • Angular
  • PHP
  • Test Automation

Candidate Requirements:

  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Electrical Engineering
  • At least 8 years of experience on hands-on development and related technologies
  • Has worked with back end technologies based and latest development frameworks
  • Has experience working with two or more of data related technologies and familiarity with others from various Relational databases, Nosql databases, Caching systems, Full Text Search engines, Big Data systems.
  • Has good experience with the TDD approach, doing unit testing, mocking, integration/UI testing, behaviour driver testing.
  • Has good experience working with, setting up and configuring any continuous integration and delivery systems, any code quality automation technologies.
  • Has experience with one or more cloud or devops services like AWS, Docker, Heroku, Digitalocean, etc.
  • Has experience with one or more front end technologies including templating, CSS and JS frameworks.

We recommend that you attend the tournament instead of applying online, as our tournament process will be much faster.

Click Apply Now > Register at the green button - you will receive the webinar link after completing registration.

Benefits

Work from anywhere
Choose your own hours
Flat organization
Work with talented people all over the world
Committed to diversity
Competitive compensation

We're running an Online Hiring Tournament on April 21st to hire SVPs of Professional Services (USD $400K/yr).

We're running an Online Hiring Tournament on April 28th to hire Java Software Architects (USD $60K/yr).

This event will include testing. Upon grading the deliverables from the event, we will set up qualified candidates with an interview with the hiring manager, who can hire 20 Java Architects. This is a 100% remote, full-time role.

This position is with ESW Capital or one of its affiliated companies.

Candidate Requirements:

  • 5+ years of experience as both a hands-on architect and a software engineer

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or Computer Engineering

  • Leadership experience in creating, deploying, and iterating excellent software

  • Proficiency in the following skills and technologies is mandatory:

    • Knowledge of backend programming languages, like C++, Java, C#, Ruby or others

    • Database(SQL server/Oracle/MySQL/MongoDB/Cassandra)

    • SOA, EDA, and Design patterns.

    • Javascript (ReactJS, AngularJS) , HTML5, CSS3

    • Cloud computing architecting

    • Linux, REST, tools for CI/CD (Jenkins), Git, and shell scripting.

    • DevOps

We recommend that you attend the tournament instead of applying online, as our tournament process will be much faster.

Click Apply Now > Register at the green button - you will receive the webinar link after completing registration.

Benefits

Work from anywhere
Choose your own hours
Flat organization
Work with talented people all over the world
Committed to diversity
Competitive compensation

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Junior, Mid-Level, Senior
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Education, E-Sports, Publishing
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: VC Funded

Job description

VNN is looking for experienced Linux full stack/PHP/Javascript Application developers. People who can make insightful, rapid, every-day decisions needed in a startup environment.

While development is 100% offsite team, candidate must be within driving distance of Grand Rapids, Michigan for in person planning meetings and company meetings and celebrations 2 or 3 times a year.

VNN enables athletic departments to leverage social technologies to promote their sports teams, in doing so crafting a unique and memorable experience for athletes. This person will be comfortable joining a small team leading that charge, based on a keen understanding of VNN’s business goals and strategy.

We need those who thrive on the pace of a start-up and embrace the many different roles they will have to play. Yet you will still be able to adapt processes and maintain strong design principles, making the trade-offs needed to meet timely delivery schedules.

While you’ll be responsible to work with a small team to ensure the successful execution of our technology strategy, you shouldn’t view yourself as a simple “developer”. Your success will also result from cultivating an ongoing relationship with operations, sales, marketing, technology partners, and advertisers leveraging those unique insights to craft user experience. Being able to work independently and in collaborative phases is a must.

Skills & Requirements

The ideal candidate can currently describe themselves or wish to develop into the type of software professional defined here: What is a Full Stack Developer?

Preferred qualifications:

  • 4+ years experience application programming languages including PHP/MySQL 
  • Ability to program in various scripting languages: Angular, React, Ansible, NodeJS, Javascript etc
  • Working knowledge of LAMP or equivalent Linux Stack
  • Ability to change directions and priorities often and quickly
  • Strong written and spoken communication skills needed for the success of a remote group that leverages Slack and Hangouts
  • Interested in sports or related activities

About VNN Inc

VNN Inc is a rapidly growing, highly progressive company that is reshaping high school sports media from the ground up.  Regardless of the role, the VNN team embraces the power of storytelling, and works to bring clarity, beauty and fun to technology that enables fans to share the stories of high school athletes.  We are a company of 60 passionate makers and hustlers, who believe in the disruptive impact the right team and technology can have on an industry.  Our work begins with a deep understanding of the parents, athletes, coaches and administrators that make up high school sports, and ends with simple fun products that impact real people across the country. 

Working with our tight-knit team, you won’t have to worry about big company bureaucracy or not having an impact, the code you work on will be used by thousands on a daily basis.

Benefits

Free Snacks
Great working environment
Get Paid What you Deserve
Health Care
Flexible Remote Team

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=16, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=5, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=2, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=66}
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior
Role: Frontend Developer
Industry: CRM, Marketing Software, Real Estate
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Senior Front End Engineer (ES2015, Angular 1.x and RxJS) (REMOTE or ONSITE)

Lasso is the developer of the leading cloud-based, on-demand Customer Relationship Management (CRM) software for the new-home-building industry.

We’re looking for a strong technical front-end engineer who really enjoys the challenges of state-management in user interfaces. Our app was initially written in Angular 1.x, but our approach moves it close to how modern apps use React - no two-way data binding, no global state, data is passed down and events bubble up (via event handlers.)

State is managed by a Reflux-like approach with RxJS streams. A state stream consumes various action-streams, and produces a state object that’s passed to the top-level angular directive.

We’re looking for someone who really loves writing front-end software and solving the various technical challenges that arise - optimizing time-to-first-meaningful-paint, optimizing bundle size and page load time, reducing input latency, etc.

If you’re excited about progressive web apps, efficient resource caching with service workers or experimenting with the newest Javascript-targeting transpiling languages, please don’t hesitate to reach out.

As a fully remote team, communication is extremely important - there is no chance to drop in on interesting discussions around the water cooler, or to see if someone is busy just by glancing at their desk. We have systems to signal busy-ness; regular meetings and stand-ups to disseminate information, frequent one-on-ones to ensure there are no frustrations building up, a code of conduct and a formal complaint process to resolve conflicts early-on.

As a key member of our front-end team, you’ll:

  • Implemented requirements provided by the UX developer
  • Tackle difficult coding problems like caching and concurrency
  • Write effective high-quality code with a focus on performance and maintainability
  • Improve our architecture
  • Maintain and optimize our front-end build processes
  • Create reliable tests and work closely with our QA team for end-to-end testing

Requirements:

  • You thrive in a self-directed and open work environment. There’s no boss breathing down your neck, no deadlines, no fixed work hours and no in-office requirements. It’s really important that you can manage your time well, and you know what you need in order to do your job well (e.g. what work hours to pick so you have enough time to communicated with team members effectively)
  • Lots of experience building and maintaining single-page apps
  • Familiarity with multiple modern Javascript and CSS frameworks
  • Experience with modern front-end build processes and current trends like new languages transpiling to Javascript or compiling to WASM
  • Familiarity with functional programming and bonus points for reactive programming experience
  • Experience with automated testing of client side Javascript (both integration and unit tests)
  • Good understanding of front-end performance optimizations

Benefits:

We take our software very seriously while fostering a relaxed, fun, and supportive environment. Here are some of the things we provide:

  • Work where and how you are most productive
  • You are not required to be in the office. Start time and work times are flexible
  • We’ll provide a development setup of your choosing, whether it’s a Macbook Pro or the components for a nice PC tower, you can pick whatever works best for you
  • Pick your own tools. We use what we know best. Windows, Mac, Linux, whatever you like
  • We provide you with a tools budget that you can use to make yourself productive ($300 per purchase, no authorization needed)
  • We know learning is a must on and off the job. We provide formal education matching (up to $1500 yearly) and funding for other continued learning, conferences, and workshops
  • Medical and Dental benefits
  • Great Vancouver-market salary

Interested?

Lasso’s vision is to be the technology hub for new home sales in North America by providing a unique combination of remarkable software and expert services. To achieve our vision we need great developers. That’s why we’ve created a great work environment, encouraging self-direction, personal development, and teamwork. If you think you’re a good fit, send your resume and cover letter to careers@lassocrm.com.

Lasso is privately held and based in Richmond, BC, Canada. To learn more please visit www.lassocrm.com.

Benefits

Remote work
Self-directed working environment
Can spend up to $300 on job-related purchases per purchase
People of processes
Greatly influence product and team culture
Data & Fact-driven decision making
Education and training budget

Job description

PopResearch is on a mission to simplify market research data collection and analysis for the masses.  This can only be accomplished by leveraging the most innovative technologies in the world.  Our platforms run on AWS and we are not wed to any one specific technology solution and choose to leverage everything at our disposal. Want to learn?  Want to try new things?  What are you waiting for?  If you have the skills, then let's build something together.

  • Design, implement, test, deploy, and monitor software using a variety of platforms and technologies
  • Develop highly available and scalable web applications and services
  • Work closely with users to develop project requirements and generate test plans
  • Stay current with new technologies and encouraged to implement innovative solutions
  • Participate in code reviews

The right candidate will also be comfortable joining a remote team that's distributed across the globe.

Skills & Requirements

  • 1-3 years relevant work experience with web applications and/or services
  • Strong knowledge of data structures and algorithms
  • Strong object-oriented analysis and design skills
  • Strong commitment to quality
  • Demonstrated ability to mentor younger developers
  • DevOps mentality
  • Preference provided to developers with applicable experience any the below:
  • Frontend:  Javascript, ES6, AJAX, CSS, Sass, React, jQuery, Angular
  • Backend: Python, Django, Node, PHP, Java, Symfony
  • Web Services and APIs: REST, SOAP, GraphQL, JSON, XML
  • Relational Databases: PostgresMySQL, Oracle, MS SQL Server,
  • NoSQL and Non-Relational Datastores: Redis, Dynamo DB, Memcached, Cassandra
  • Platforms: Docker, Linux, Amazon Web Services
  • Tools: Git, Confluence, Jira, Mocha
  • The ideal candidate will have a passion for learning and applying new technologies, and will be eager to share what they have learned with colleagues
  • Preference for Bachelor's/Master's degree in Computer Science or equivalent combination of education and applied development experience

About PopResearch

PopResearch provides easy access to highly-targeted global survey respondents, survey programming and data visualization services for market research and consulting firms. Driven by a passion for simplifying data collection, the team at PopResearch is personally invested in giving clients the ultimate customer service experience.

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Digital Health, Health & Fitness
Company size: 501-1k people
Company type: Private

Job description

NOTE: THIS IS A REMOTE POSITION FOR US BASED CANDIDATES ONLY

We are seeking a Senior Software Engineer (JavaScript focused) to join our team and play a vital role in our solution delivery teams.  This role includes definition, architecture and implementation of solutions in support of StayWell product lines. You will be challenged to turn solutions around quickly but thoughtfully, balancing speed to delivery with security, quality, longevity and scalability.  The Senior Software Engineer will also be integral in helping to cultivate an environment of innovation through development guidance and evangelism of best practices to ensure the team is equipped to deliver industry leading solutions for our customers and patients. 

Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following (other duties may be assigned):

  • Develop solutions that add value and efficiency across systems with minimal technical debt. 
  • Collaborate closely with fellow developers, product owners and other stakeholders in determining optimal solutions to product goals.
  • Deliver code with a Test First mentality and a heavy focus on quality at the code level.  
  • Stay informed on technology trends and product roadmaps to make strategic solution architecture recommendations.
  • Support development of cross-functional business processes; identify alternative solutions, assess feasibility, and recommend new approaches via technology enablement.
  • Contribute to architecture models, frameworks and artifacts (e.g. current and future state application architecture diagrams, data models, etc.).


Qualified candidates will have experience in the following:

  • Experience leveraging modern technology stacks and cloud-based systems such as AWS.  Preferred technology stack expertise includes JavaScript (strong), Node, React, React Native
  • Solid experience with distributed version control systems and branch strategies (Git + Gitflow)
  • Proven understanding of agile methodologies (Scaled Agile Framework preferred, SCRUM required)
  • Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills with the ability to exercise mature judgment
  • Knowledge of various architectural approaches such as microservices, messaging, queuing, API patterns, etc. are preferred

Education and/or Experience:
Bachelor's degree (B. S.) in Computer related subject area or related business field and six (6) or more year’s experience in Information Technology and solution delivery, or equivalent combination of education and experience in similar fields is required. Experience working with SAAS based solution delivery organization (preferred).
EEO Employer

About StayWell

At StayWell, we believe in the transformational power of health. Through the science of behavior change, education and inspiration, we have taken the guess work out of healthy living. And we do this by empowering people to take active roles in their own health – whether they’re patients, employees, or individuals just trying to stay well. We help inspire people to become healthier, happier employees at work. We help them have a more balanced and rewarding life at home. And we provide information that helps make patients smarter. In fact, everything we do maximizes the likelihood of the best possible outcomes. Which has a positive impact on families, businesses and communities. Because there is no mission more important than improving human health.

StayWell has a 40-year history of unparalleled expertise in improving health – whether at the point of care, in the workplace, or at home. But we know that every day the way people consume information is changing. We are continually working to integrate our proven, evidence-based solutions into forward-thinking, tech-driven delivery mechanisms, ensuring that we provide people with the right information, at the right time, and in the right way to maximize our impact on health outcomes. Our organization places great weight on technical innovation, and we’re looking for awesome tech talent to catalyze our momentum.

Our team is nearly 100% remote. We create several different product lines related to our health and wellness business and patient education content. Our history, our access to member and patient data, and the relationships we have established put us in a very unique position of truly being able to make a difference as it relates to improving our healthcare system.  

Benefits

Competitive Salary
Fitness Center and Fitness Reimbursement
Medical plans, dental and vision coverage
Work from home options
Health Savings Account, Flex Savings Account
401K Retirement Savings Plan
Tuition assistance, paid time for volunteerism

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior, Lead
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: Developer APIs, Hospitality, SaaS
Company size: 1-10 people
Company type: Private

Job description

Impala is looking to hire a Node/Javascript engineer on a permanent full time basis to help us build the technology that powers smart hotels. You'll be joining a venture funded startup that is changing the way the hospitality industry works.

You'll be working directly on building new functionality into the product as well as working on existing features. We've had more interest than we ever anticipated we're hiring early to maintain and expand the quality of Impala.

A Node/Javascript Engineer at Impala:

  • Takes ownership of features.
  • Wants to create great APIs for other developers to work with.
  • Spends time working on tooling to fix our common problems. In the past this has involved building chrome extensions and open source libraries.
  • Has a direct input in the formulation of functionality.

We are accepting fully remote applicants within Western Europe. An office stipend is provided to all employees and frequent travel to team meetings is paid.

All full-time employees will take equity stakes in the company. How much will depend on experience.

Skills & Requirements

We're looking for engineers who are genuinely interested in using the latest web technologies when they're available. We're also looking for people who can build things well and also like to ship.

You won't be asked about linked lists or binary search trees in your interview but you will be asked about ES6 and APIs that you've worked with.

The recruitment process: 

  1. Make an application with us. Successful candidates will be contacted very quickly.
  2. Complete a 20 minutes initial interview with one of the team.
  3. Complete an 30 - 90 minute technical interview/pair programming session with our Lead Engineer.
  4. Have a final conversation with our co-founders. 

The process is extremely quick but we're highly selective.

What we need to see:

  • Experience in Node
  • Experience with relational databases (Postgres preferable)
  • Experience with NoSQL databases
  • Experience with ReactJS
  • An interest in taking ownership of functionality

What we'd love to see:

  • Experience with Redux or significant experience with ReactJS
  • Experience with GraphQL
  • Experience with an ORM

About Impala

Impala is a small team, well-funded and growing quickly. In that way, we're similar to a lot of startups. In return for your hard work, we offer you:

  • A competitive salary and equity based on experience.
  • Frequent socials
  • Flexible working hours
  • The ability to work remotely
  • Time dedicated every Friday afternoon for personal projects, lightning talks and team events
  • A monthly allowance for books and other educational materials
  • The opportunity to work alongside a tight knit and driven team

Where we differ is:

  • You'll be working in a company led by an engineer. You won't be asked to do the unrealistic and your skills will be tested and improved.
  • You'll grow professionally in your role.
  • You'll have a demonstrable, strong role in product direction.
  • We work with hotels. You'll be able to travel to them (and a lot of them are in very cool places).

Benefits

Remote work possible
Pick your own gear
Genuine product involvement
Lots of opportunities for travel
State of the art office space
Flexible holiday/working time

Front-end Web Developer

What you need to do now

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior, Lead
Role: Full Stack Developer, Mobile Developer
Industry: Software Development

Company type: Private

Job description

DESCRIPTION

Clevertech is seeking an Angular/Ionic Developer Full-stack Engineer to join us in developing premium native experiences for our consumers. In this role, you will deliver well designed, highly testable, and resilient applications. You will also be instrumental in driving our mobile technology roadmap forward and evangelizing mobile development and testing practices. The successful candidate is both deeply experienced with mobile development and a team player that thrives in a collaborative agile environment.

You can deliver quickly while being clever to avoid missteps. You have an effective positive attitude that shines as you show your care about client and colleague concerns. You are always learning and are a transparent communicator even when it is challenging. You thrive on challenging yourself daily and seek to surround yourself with like minded individuals.

REQUIREMENTS

  • 5+ years of software development experience
  • Strong JavaScript coding experience
  • Ionic framework experience
  • Minimum 3 years of cumulative mobile app development, design, and/or architecture experience with technology experience from at least one of the following areas:
  • Server-side/Middleware (REST API services, microservices)
  • Native Applications (iOS, Android)
  • Exposure to Java/Postgres backend
  • Ability to effectively articulate technical challenges and solutions
  • A solid grasp of fundamental algorithms and mobile applications
  • Deal well with ambiguous/undefined problems; ability to think abstractly
  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science, mathematics, a related field or equivalent work experience
  • Strong communicator and fluent in English with excellent written and verbal communication skills.ability to lead and mentor others
  • Knowledge about the Lean Startup and Agile Methodologies

BENEFITS

Own Your Time

We are a completely remote team. That means we have a large amount of trust and a lot of flexibility. World travellers, young parents, nature lovers, and commute avoiders love working here. We also will pay for a co-working space in case you feel like working outside of your normal setting.

Recharge Time

We insist that you take recharge time. We are closed for major holidays and then require that you take at least two weeks a year to refresh.

Care For Yourself

You’ll receive a health/wellness monthly stipend that goes towards covering medical insurance, dental insurance or joining a gym!

Focused Work

You will work together on a dedicated team with your eye on one finish line at a time. Our teams are nimble and agile, and cover the technical range you would expect in world class product delivery teams.

Learn at your edges

We believe in learning and provide unique programs that improve your tech skills, leadership skills and even challenge you in personal development. CleverFridays, guest speakers, mentor-ship opportunities and in-depth industry exposure are all on offer here. And of course, if you speak at a tech conference, we cover all expenses.

Clevertech Swag

And keep your eye on the mail - we send out swag everywhere in the world and there are celebratory pictures of Clevertech socks, hoodies, and mugs all over slack.

Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team? Check out why.clevertech.biz.

About Clevertech

We’re always looking for smart, driven, entrepreneurial developers to join our team.

If you like new ideas and want to work with a virtual but absurdly talented group of people in a learning-friendly environment, check out the open positions.

No matter what you do at Clevertech, you'll play a part in transforming ideas into software that changes the world.

Just answer a few quick questions and learn a little more about our culture.

We’re waiting for you, and ready to do great things together!

Benefits

Full-Time Telecommuting
Flexible Schedules
Paid Time Off
Ability to Work with Cutting-Edge Technology
Opportunity to Work with and Learn from Top Developers
Contribute to Open Source

items.title: Parashift AG: Senior Angular Developer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=10, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=2, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=63}
items.content:
Senior Angular Developer

Posted Apr 24

Parashift AG
Headquarters: Sissach, Basel Land, Switzerland
https://tech.parashift.io/jobs/senior-angular-developer-remote.html
View all Parashift AG jobs →

We are looking for passionate and experienced Angular developers to join our local or remote team. Our office is located in Sissach, but we are also looking for remote people.

Please understand, that we can only accept candidates within a certain range, as a major part of our work style is, that we regularly meet with the team in different places. Also having similar time zones makes things much easier for us. Please only apply if you are within 3 hours flight travel time to Basel, as well as within a maximum of 2 time zones apart.

You will be developing products related to the financial industry. A few examples you might be working on:

  • Implement new features into our current applications like the Accounto App. 
  • New products, set up base architecture, and integrate existing modules. 
  • Improving our infrastructure. 
  • You might help our support teams and possibly fix bugs. 
  • Implement mobile apps as well as desktop apps based on the same codebase.

Tech Requirements

  • Expert skills with Angular (Not AngularJS), Typescript, Javascript, SASS, Bootstrap. 
  • Well experienced with Angular unit and e2e testing. 
  • Proficient with Git and Github. 
  • Docker experience welcome, but not necessary. 
  • Experience using Agile Methodologies and Test Driven Development. 
  • Experience with Ruby or Python is a plus but not necessary. 
  • Perfect would be experience with Electron.

What we expect from you

  • Write well designed, testable, efficient senior level code by using best software development practices. 
  • Be comfortable coming into a large codebase and be able to follow existing patterns, conventions, and figuring out how existing code fits and works together. Recommend better ways and discuss this with the team to increase our overall standards. 
  • Have strong opinions on how software should be produced, but are willing to make compromises when appropriate. 
  • Provide input, options, and recommendations on software features and system enhancements. 
  • Gather and refine specifications and requirements based on technical needs. 
  • Provide recommendations into emerging technologies/industry trends and apply them into operations and activities. 
  • Communicate with the team. Share the problems you have to get help from the team. 
  • Share your experience to help the team grow. 
  • Work according to priorities which have been set by you or your coworkers such that we can rely on your work.

Apply for this position

Please apply on our job page: https://tech.parashift.io/jobs/senior-angular-developer-remote.html

items.title: Forward Action: Freelance Frontend Developer - 4 days work in June
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=2, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=8, gamedev=0, php=10, embedded=0, frontend=47}
items.content:
Freelance Frontend Developer - 4 days work in June

Posted Apr 24

Forward Action
Headquarters: London, UK
https://forwardaction.uk/
View all Forward Action jobs →

Summary

We are looking for a Freelance front end developer to do 4 days of work over the first 2 weeks of June 2018. And after that, if everything goes well, we would like to add them to the group of freelancers that we regularly call on to work with.

You will be taking a design (probably in Zeplin.io) and turning it into a growth-focused microsite, an example of which is here.

We’re a remote-working first organisation and are happy to hear from anyone within a time difference of 1 hour of London who is willing to work London hours. You will also have the option to work from our London office in Hoxton.

To apply for this role, please fill out the short application form here: https://forwardaction.typeform.com/to/bVoAk8?source=weworkremotely by 11:59 pm on 7th May 2018. Shortlisted candidates will be asked to attend a short interview via a video call.

Who we are
Forward Action is a full service digital agency for progressive causes. We work with clients from campaign conception through to results, creating strategies, content and tools to get the job done.

Our clients are some of the most exciting and impactful organisations in campaigning, including Greenpeace, The Labour Party, Amnesty International, WaterAid, and SumOfUs.

Abilities and experience you’ll need to have
  • 2+ years experience building responsive web pages

  • Fluency in JavaScript, JQuery, HTML and CSS

  • Enthusiasm for thinking creatively and coming up with solutions to web development problems

  • Being comfortable working in a fast-paced environment

  • Good organisation and attention-to-detail

  • Dedication to helping build a fairer, more progressive society

  • Fluency in spoken and written English


Abilities and experience that are nice to have
We know it’s not possible for any applicants to have all these skills - it’s likely you’ll be able to bring a few of the following to our team:
  • Experience using Vue.js or another modern JavaScript framework

  • Experience working within a PHP MVC application

  • Experience working with Google Cloud Platform, specifically Google App Engine

  • A solid understanding of online user experience (e.g. how to lay out a web page to improve conversion rates)

  • Experience working at an agency

  • Experience building WordPress themes

  • Experience setting up Google Analytics / GTM

  • Experience setting up AB tests

Why work with Forward Action?
Our values are critical to us: we will only work with causes that make the world a better place. You will get to work with some of the most inspiring and impactful organisations in the sector, and spend your days helping win progress on everything from climate change to access to clean water in developing countries.

You will be working at the cutting edge of digital campaigning. We recognise that what we do can always be tested and improved, so we constantly pursue innovation. We are an agile, fast-moving team, and you will have the opportunity to rapidly develop and expand your skills and experience.

We are an equal opportunity company and are committed to giving equal opportunities to everyone who applies for this role. Our team is open, inclusive, friendly, respectful and kind.

Apply for this position

To apply for this role, please fill out the short application form here: https://forwardaction.typeform.com/to/bVoAk8?source=weworkremotely by 11:59 pm on 7th May 2018. Shortlisted candidates will be asked to attend a short interview via a video call.

items.title: ✪ Developer at pet-tech startup
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=9, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=14}
items.content:
*Tailwise is disrupting the global dog industry by radically innovating the way people find and buy the right dog*. Currently buying a dog is a case of buyer beware with around 40% of dogs coming from poor breeding backgrounds - this has to change!

*Our vision is to help everyone would be dog owner connect with trusted breeders and healthy dogs*

You’ll be joining an experienced founding team with the opportunity to work on a greenfield tech project. It is a rarity that you find a company which is:

* Solving a global problem
* Building something which matters
* In a passionate, value driven sector with dogs!

*About this role*

You will play a big role in the key development of our product and will work to build a robust, fast and engaging product with a clean and flexible codebase to help shape the future of our growing development team. We firmly believe that technology is the core of our business and aim to build the best, most diverse tech team in London.

*Key skills*

Experience building modern web applications at various stages including from scratch. Value code quality, ease of maintainability and documentation.
Product minded and able to empathise with the user and non-developer colleagues. Solid background in various testing methodologies, with an eye on performance and previous experience leading or mentoring small teams, would be ideal but not essential.

*Tech stack*

We’re stack agnostic and this is not a prescriptive list, it's just some things we like... you'd have a lot of say in how we move forward.

* JavaScript
* ExpressJs or other Node Server frameworks
* React
* HTML5 / CSS3
* SQL, PostgreSQL
* Google Cloud Platform and/or AWS, Heroku

*Our values*

We’re honest, driven, and execution focused. Above all, we’re down to earth, positive, fun and we get things done.

*What we can offer*

* Opportunity to become a key player at a unique, value-driven startup
* Ability to work from home
* Share options in the company
* A great holiday policy
* A dog-friendly office
* Salary dependent on experience

Don’t meet all the criteria above? No problem, we’re still interested in hearing from you!

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=13, embedded=0, frontend=22}
items.content:
Senior ReactJS Front End Engineer at CoachList

San Francisco Bay Area, Bengaluru, Remote · Full Time
Skills
PHP, Javascript, SQL, Apache, Linux, HTML5 & CSS3, Laravel, React.js
Compensation
$24K–$80K
1.0%–3.0%
Visa Sponsorship
Available

Job Description

CoachList, Inc. is developing the sports industry’s most comprehensive athlete development, training, and sports service provider online marketplace. CoachList’s goal is to disrupt the sports industry by creating the world’s largest online ecosystem that connects and advances athletes and sports service providers.

We are in the initial stages of putting together an excellent engineering organization. If you have ever had strong opinions about how teams spend more time in meetings than writing code, planning and re-planning deadlines and fictitious milestones. If you believe in solving complex and difficult problems with simple and usable solutions that make sense. Then, CoachList might be just the team you want to be part of. We are a small group of engineers bringing together a really smart and efficient team that can solve interesting and challenging problems in the world of sports and athletics.

You will report to the VP of Engineering and will be involved in building powerful and engaging consumer experiences that can touch the lives of millions of aspiring and established sports professionals. This position comes with a lot of feature ownership responsibilities and is empowered and encouraged to make quick decisions impacting the efficiency and direction of the technology stack. Primary responsibilities would include:

• Learn, Research and Solve complex problems involving marketplace, scheduling and loyalty management in the world of athletics, sports and coaching.
• Be part of a really agile development team and proactively own feature development by coordinating requirements, schedules, and activities; contributing to team meetings; troubleshooting development and production problems across multiple environments and operating platforms.
• Continually updates skillets to keep the CoachList stack on the edge and performant.
