items.content:
*We are looking for a Senior Frontend Developer (m/f)*

Adspert is an automated digital media buying platform using machine learning to allocate advertising budgets in the most efficient way. We process dozens of thousands of signals every second and continuously improve the advertising KPIs.

Join Adspert at an exciting stage of growth as we diversify our software solutions and expand to the new markets.

We are a strong team of mathematicians, IT professionals and online marketing gurus based in Berlin, European start-up and adtech capital. Our founders have come to advertising from fintech bringing a strong entrepreneurial background and a good knowledge how lots of number crunching helps to maximise the return on the investments.

We develop our solutions with Python, Go, JavaScript and PostgreSQL and mainly work on Linux and macOS. Distributed version control, good test coverage and automated deployment are fundamental to our development process.

*Your tasks:*

* Take the lead role in selecting frontend tools and developing the new dashboard

* Help select new frameworks to develop our REST API and consolidate multiple existing product interfaces

* Work closely with our product managers and software developers

* Ensure that our web applications run on different platforms (i.e. taking into account responsive design, cross-
browser compatibility, etc.).

*Your profile:*

* Experience in creating responsive dashboards in a SaaS company. Able to provide examples of the projects you
worked on in a frontend role

* Excellent knowledge of web development and modern JS frameworks (Angular, ReactJS, Backbone, Ember, etc.).

* Already worked with tools like Grunt, Webpack or Gulp.

* Nice to have: experience with Flux, Mocha/Jasmine, PhantomJS, AWS, Python.

* Solid understanding of version control, automated testing and deployment processes.

* Good sense of design, UX and simplicity.

* 3+ years of experience in frontend development.

* Good English language skills, German language skills are a bonus.

*In return we offer:*

* Competitive salary

* Setup of your choice – select the hardware and we’ll make it happen

* Challenging but relaxed work culture

* Flexible hours

* Possibility for regular remote work

* Possibility of offsite work sessions to spark up creativity for you and your team

* Tickets for selected tech conferences

* Yearly income statements done by our tax office

Have we sparked your interest?
Apply now! Send your application including your salary expectation as well as your possible starting date.

items.content:
Web Support Specialist (PST timezone)

Posted Apr 9

Zapiet
Headquarters: London, UK
https://www.zapiet.com
View all Zapiet jobs →

Zapiet (https://www.zapiet.com) are the leading provider of store pickup and local delivery solutions for Shopify and are known for providing an exceptional customer support experience. Shopify is a rapidly growing commerce platform with 600k+ merchants in over 150 countries.

About the role
The support team at Zapiet provide merchants with responsive, detailed support with configuring their online store for pickups and deliveries. We go above and beyond by assisting merchants with minor customizations, configuration of third party services and personal recommendations for getting the most out of our apps.

An ideal match for this role is someone who has great troubleshooting and analytical skills, a curious mind for how things work, an affinity for helping and teaching customers, and is inspired by making online shopping better. Zapiet is constantly pushing the boundaries of commerce and our support team needs to understand our apps inside out.

You’ll need to have:
  • Experience with Shopify and configuring Shopify apps.

  • Understanding of Shopify’s Liquid templating engine.

  • Familiarity with a support ticketing system, particularly Zendesk.

  • A technical background in responsive web development, including HTML5, CSS, and Javascript.

  • The ability to evaluate, troubleshoot, and follow-up on customer issues as well as replicate and document for further escalation.

  • The capacity to work with a remote, distributed support team and identify opportunities for documentation and customer education.

  • Effectively communicate with non-technical customers while providing detailed, technical instructions.

About you:
This is a remote position so you can work from home, a coffee shop, patio or the comfort of your bed so long as you have a stable internet connection. We are specifically looking for somebody located in the PST timezone. 

You must be passionate about customer success and helping the team.

You must have a great sense of humour, have a strong desire to learn, and are a great communicator.

Most importantly, you must be incredibly resourceful and really enjoy problem solving.

This is a full-time position with a flexible vacation policy. Please specify your salary expectations for this opportunity. We appreciate everyone who applies but will only be following up with the most qualified candidates.

Apply for this position

careers@zapiet.com

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=5, dotnet=23, c=6, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=3, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=30, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=30}
items.content:
We are looking for a developer with some prior “full-stack” experience and a desire to develop by working with a variety of technologies to join our dev team.

We work in an Agile development environment and maintain several products in a range of languages including:

A centralised data platform exposed through REST APIs currently built primarily with Rails.
A remotely managed, distributed network of agents deployed in schools throughout the country, written in C# and Atom.
Customer facing web apps currently in React and Rails with some new projects starting in Elixir/Phoenix and React/TypeScript.

You will get involved with our whole product range and, as such, will have the opportunity to be exposed to all of the technologies mentioned above with a focus on the back-end systems but plenty of opportunity to be involved in the UI/UX should you so desire.

We’re a semi-remote team and are flexible to applicants who wish to work from outside the office.

About You

Excited by the idea of working in edtech (though experience in the sector not essential).
Comfortable working within an agile environment, including pair programming, test driven development and continuous delivery.
Happy to work in a cross-functional team and work across projects as required.
At least 2 years of professional dev experience.

Skills
Strong C#/.NET skills are essential as this will make up approx 30-50% of the role.
Experience with at least one dynamically typed language, e.g: Ruby, Python, Groovy, JavaScript etc...
Some Proficiency with the Ruby programming language and the Ruby on Rails web framework would be a big bonus.
A good understanding of web technologies and how they fit together (HTTP, HTML, CSS, Javascript).
Experience working with relational databases.
Comfortable working within an agile environment, including; pair programming, test driven development and continuous delivery.
Previous experience with the AWS platform and experience of working with (or at least an interest in) Docker containers would also be an advantage.
Knowledge and previous experience of scaling HTTP based services.

Pay & Benefits
£38-48k depending on experience, with opportunities for progression
Your own choice of tech set-up (including brand-new MacBook or equivalent)
Annual training and conference budget
25 days annual leave
11% non-contributory pension
Season ticket loans, childcare vouchers and retailer discounts

items.title: Full Stack Developer @ Bikmo - Adventure sports insurance
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=8, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=13, embedded=0, frontend=9}
items.content:
Bikmo is an adventure sports technology company, with a simple mission to provide exceptional services that enable our customers to spend more time exploring the great outdoors.

Focussing initially on insurance in the cycling sector, we're now live in the UK, Ireland, Germany and Austria and by utilising sector expertise, technology, a love for the sport and an open approach to data, we've won customers, partners, awards and 5-star reviews.

We are searching for a technically excellent and self-starting full stack developer to join our CTO in developing the platform that will enable us to achieve this ambition. Rapid application development allows us to adapt to our customers' needs and stay one step ahead of the competition, so we're looking for an applicant with an agile and adaptive mind.

Our ideal candidate would be one who has as much energy for adventure sports as they do coding - you can live and work in the heart of the Alps, the UK or where you choose.

The role:

You will be working on a number of existing applications, and aiding with the creation of new application as and when they are needed. Our applications use middleware stacks to allow efficient re-use of encapsulated code, and the rapid development and deployment of new systems and feature sets. As a startup, we are moving at a rapid pace and the successful candidate will need to be able to get up to speed quickly and work self-sufficiently.

In our back-end work we follow PHP-fig standards where they apply. We check our code for 'mess' and standards before sharing with remote repos and other projects. We use the git-flow branching strategy, and code review via pull-request.

In our front-end work we build templates in Twig which can be integrated into existing and new PHP server-side projects. Developers need to have a good understanding of how data can be provided from and delivered to the back-end application, through template rendering, form submission and API interaction. They need to be able to use composition and inheritance to implement an effective, efficient templating strategy.

Valuable experience of using JS, and JQuery where appropriate, is essential to any of our front-end work. The developer should be able to manipulate the DOM to provide an exceptional user experience, and use application logic to interact with the back end application on-page.

Benefits:

This role is a full time role at 38 hours per week, Monday to Friday.

The Bikmo HQ is based in Chester, but you do not need to be. Everyone in the Bikmo team works remotely to some degree. We also have offices in Innsbruck and Munich which you are welcome to work in.

It will be highly beneficial to spend the initial phase of your employment sitting side-by-side with our CTO Jorj, in order to get to grips with our existing systems, our roadmap, and our working expectations. This can either be done at one of our offices, or, potentially, at your work environment if it's more practical for Jorj to spend time there instead.

As a growing business, our benefit structure is under review and will include a share options scheme and holiday entitlement boost.

Holiday is pro rata at 28 days per year, inclusive of bank holidays. You get an additional day of leave for your birthday and may take 1 day per month for riding adventures / 12 days per year - in return for content for our magazine.

Your application:

Please include a bit about you/your CV of LinkedIn profile and answers to the following questions with your application;

1. Talk about your preferred development environment: computer, software, and office.
2. What did you learn this week?
3. What is at the top of your riding (cycling, snowboarding, etc.) bucket-list?

items.title: Front-end Developer (remote)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=8, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=10, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=2, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=52}
items.content:
Rush are an innovative new company who are on a mission to change gambling for good.

We believe that sports fans are the heart of the industry and should always be treated that way. By working closely with them and by sharing with the community, we are building a platform that changes the rules of the industry forever. We’re building it from the ground up, using the most innovative technologies in the world.

The end result: A change for the good whilst giving half of our net profits back to the fans.

Our Mission

Our mission is to disrupt a huge industry full of sleeping giants. You don’t have to be a fan of gambling (or even sport!) to join us, but you do have to be a fan of wanting to use the latest technology to change something that we believe is fundamentally flawed. If you have a passion for all things technical and love the idea of working on groundbreaking and exciting tech projects, we’re right up your street.

So who are we?
* A multitalented talented, international, cross-functional team spread out right across the globe!
* A well funded company, with investment and backing from key industry leaders from both the world of sport and gaming
* A truly collaborative environment, working across multiple projects together making great things
* Autonomy and trust, take ownership and control of your own work
* Working on a highly respected concept – “Too good to be true” said some of football’s leading players and contributors who are now on board and taking the first steps of this exciting journey with us!

What are we looking for?
We’re looking for talented engineers to help us build great things. We’re cross-functional, managing both B2B and B2C components across multiple exciting projects within the Rush group, so it’s important to us you work well in a collaborative environment.

See the opportunity - you’ll be a key team member so we expect you to step up and help shape the team as we grow.
Make your voice heard - collaboration and the ability to express ideas is key. Decisions are made based on the best ideas, not who came up with them no matter if it’s you’re first day or you’ve been with us a while.
Be a self-starter – we’re a startup and so you should be self-motivated, have energy, drive and be ready to make the difference.
Think critically - with a strong ability to solve problems and collaborate on ideas, you’ll help influence our technical direction.

A depth of knowledge – you’ve been there and done it. You know your stuff and that’s what makes you a crucial, go-to member of the team.

Flexible approach - an open mind and ability to adapt. While sharing your own knowledge and experience, you’re still keen to learn from the experiences of others too.

Ok, sounds good. So what would I be doing?

Great question! You’ll be working across a variety of exciting greenfield projects, including our already established Fantasy Brands, as well as our B2B operations and real-time data-driven platform (as well as something else we’re pretty excited about... but we're playing our cards pretty close to our chest on that one for now!)

As a Front-end developer, you’ll be involved in everything we’re building with all kinds of different challenges. Reporting directly to our Head of Engineering, your advice and input will contribute directly to strategic decisions that will affect our company roadmap. Everything from helping deploy modern web applications to implementing statistical models, using real time data streaming to handling distributed cloud infrastructure.

This is an opportunity to come and be an important part of a small yet diverse and talented team working on revolutionising the space with the best new technologies while disrupting a huge industry in the process.

REQUIREMENTS
What is our technical stack/requirements?

Experienced with modern JS and tooling (ES6+, TypeScript, webpack preferred)
Use modern frameworks (Vue, React) and state management (Redux/Vuex)
Realtime, Web Workers, Proxies, WebSockets (and other modern browser technologies)
Strong understanding of HTML and modern CSS
What are some of our daily challenges?

Building real time, sports based applications in the browser - processing live sports data through websockets and other modern frontend technologies.
Creating great user experiences through user-centred design and product development.
Ensuring code is reliable, well tested and deployed regularly.
Crafting customer facing and internal products; creating elegant and effective applications to visualise and interact with data.
Interacting with our backend services and REST APIs and helping to make those platforms better.
Collaborating with the team on innovative new games and features.

BENEFITS
Great Salary: We only want the best
Stock Options: Because we believe it’s important for us all to share in the success together
Generous Bonus Package: You’ve worked hard, above and beyond in fact, and we believe commitment should be rewarded
Flexible/Remote working: With over 80% of our team either working remote full-time or utilising our flexi hours policy, it’s important to us you have the flexibility you need.
Amazing London office: Though we have a great remote working policy, we also have a fantastic central London location situated right on the doorstep of Paddington station!
Free drinks: On those days you do stop by, we have both draft beer and cider on tap everyday from 4pm. (Well, it would be a shame to let it go to waste!)
Health Insurance: Just. In. Case. Because your health is key
Pension Contribution: You’re helping us plan for now, it’s only right we help you plan for later
Generous Learning/Conference budget: We believe good talent should not only be celebrated, but invested in too!
Team Events and Activities: Work hard, play hard.
Choice of hardware: It’s important you feel comfortable and have the right tools for the job. (Honestly Mac or Windows, we promise we won’t judge)
Relocation Fee to UK for EU citizens: relocating can be a big decision, but we’re here to help you every step of the way

items.content:
*About us*

Planes is a young digital product studio, started by two friends who liked making great products together. Taking our various experiences building and growing startups we have built a studio that is helping all sorts of people, from international fin-tech providers, launch new apps to startups building their MVPs. A nimble team, we work collaboratively to produce work that we are proud of and our clients love.

We also believe that side projects are what make life fun, and use our commercial work to give us the ability to all work on our own things together. Our internal goal is to build one new product a month with others, giving them the launchpad to start their own businesses while ensuring we are constantly evolving and creating.

*The Role*

As a small company, your role will not be just coding, you will be involved in the whole product lifecycle and likely be dealing with clients too. We are based out of WeWork in Bishopsgate but we are relatively flexible about where you work from and when you work.

What we are using right now:
* React
* React Native

Other bits we are interested in:
* Experience working on enterprise software
* Agency experience

Perks:
* Unlimited WeWork beer
* Unlimited holiday
* WeWork office and membership in the City

* Committed to building one internal project a month completely for us

If you are interested, please send us through your CV/portfolio/GitHub/side projects along with a short cover letter about who you are and what you are into.

items.content:
Junior Software Engineer @ Clerky

2018-04-08 03:19

Description

Help fix the legal industry!

The way legal transactions are done is filled with inefficiencies, which leads to ridiculously high legal fees. We're fixing this by building software that automates and streamlines the process.

We're profitable and growing sustainably. We're the most popular way for high-growth technology startups to incorporate. Y Combinator and other top accelerators use our software to handle their investment paperwork. Our product is used by tons of top tier startups and investors.

We're a quiet leader in the legal technology space - if you are interested in changing the legal industry, this is arguably the best place to be.

Notes on our stack and process:

  • Our backend is mostly in Ruby on Rails, with very small amounts of Scala and Go as well.
  • Our front-end is mostly in Ember.
  • We use CI extensively for linting, tests, visual diffs, and deployment.
  • We're not religious about any particular technology - we believe in using the right tool for a given problem.

This is a great fit if you want to work:

  • ... at a product-driven company bringing an old-fashioned industry into the future
  • ... on a complex product, with a ton of engineering challenges
  • ... on a well-loved product with a lot of usage and visibility in the startup community
  • ... in a company that strongly values good software development practices
  • ... at a financially sound company
  • ... with bright people who are extremely passionate about their work
  • ... where you'll be a key early software engineer

As a junior software engineer at Clerky, you will:

  • Maintain and add features to our Middleman and Gitbook sites
  • Maintain our builds and continuous integration setups
  • Investigate bugs and sporadic test failures
  • Implement features and fix bugs in our main application
  • Work with top-notch senior engineers (all of us have 10+ years experience)

Firm requirements:

  • Strong ability to learn on your own. You will receive some mentorship and guidance from our senior software engineers, but you should expect to learn mostly on your own.
  • Discipline and patience to write clean code and use best practices. We are unlike most startups and write code to last - we do not rapidly iterate on prototypes.

This position is 100% remote. We are happy to support an H-1B visa application after 2 years of employment.

Country

Anywhere
